title: Typographical Fleurons
content:
Some interesting information and photos of a Canadian company that purchased the old Lanston type library and the Lanston Monotype punch cutting and matrix manufacturing department from San Francisco.   
This is also where Sumner Stone had his original ITC Stone Serif cut.   
 [Go to the Lanston Type Library](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108050834/http:/lanstontype.com/GiampaTour.html/)  
This is a great link to the page showing the masterful use of typographical fleurons.   
 [Fleuron page](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108050834/http:/www.lanstontype.com/ATF.html/)
author: anonymous

comments.content:
Sorry about the bad links, it is corrected now.   
I should have also previewed the links.
